example.eg: George is the nominal head of the business, but really he retired years ago; his children are the ones running things.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 名义上的, 有名无实的

example.eg: Nominal phrases can contain nouns as well as other parts of speech.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 名词的, 起名词作用的

example.eg: If you buy the vacuum you can also get a set of accessories for it for a nominal charge.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 象征性收费, 极少的费用

example.eg: The singer agreed to perform for a nominal fee so that most of the proceeds could go to charity.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 象征性的费用, 小额费用

example.eg: The nominal price of the car is $25,000.

dsense.name: nominal rate
dsense.guideword: (interest rate not adjusted for inflation) (未调整通货膨胀因素的利率)

example.eg: The bank charges a nominal rate on the loan.

dsense.name: nominal value
dsense.guideword: (amount a share is worth initially) (股票)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 名义价值，票面价值，面值
极少的工资，配不上付出劳动的报酬
